sen.j: 源 資賢（みなもと の すけかた、永久 (元号)元年（1113年） - 文治4年2月26日 (旧暦)（1188年3月25日））は、平安時代末期の公卿・雅楽家。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Sukekata (1113 - March 25, 1188) was a Kugyo (the top court official) and gagakuka (musician of old Japanese court music), who lived during the late Heian Period.
MINAMOTO no Sukekata (1113 - April 1, 1188) was a Kugyo (the top court official) and gagakuka (musician of old Japanese court music), who lived during the late Heian period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。period補足しました。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Sukekata (1113 - April 1, 1188) was a Kugyo (the top court official) and gagakuka (musician of old Japanese court music), who lived during the late Heian period.
He was from Uda-Genji.
He was from Uda-Genji (Minamoto clan).
He was from Uda-Genji (Minamoto clan).

sen.j: 宮内卿・源有賢の子で、母は備中国守・高階為家の女。
sen.e: He was the son of Kunaikyo (Minister of the Sovereign's Household) MINAMOTO no Arikata, and his mother was the daughter of Governor of Bicchu Province TAKASHINA no Tameie.
He was the son of Kunaikyo (Minister of the Sovereign's Household) MINAMOTO no Arikata, and his mother was the daughter of Governor of Bicchu Province TAKASHINA no Tameie.
He was the son of Kunaikyo (Minister of the Sovereign's Household) MINAMOTO no Arikata, and his mother was the daughter of Governor of Bicchu Province TAKASHINA no Tameie.

sen.j: 子に源通家・源資時・賢祐らがいた。
sen.e: His sons were MINAMOTO no Michiie, MINAMOTO no Suetoki, MINAMOTO no Kensuke, and others.
His sons were MINAMOTO no Michiie, MINAMOTO no Suetoki, MINAMOTO no Kensuke, and others.
His sons were MINAMOTO no Michiie, MINAMOTO no Suetoki, MINAMOTO no Kensuke, and others.

sen.j: 笛や和琴の名手で、後白河天皇の音楽の師であり側近でもあった。
sen.e: He was a master of flute and wagon (Japanese harp), and he was Emperor Goshirakawa's music teacher and close adviser.
He was a master of flute and wagon (Japanese harp), and he was Emperor Goshirakawa's music teacher and close adviser.
He was a master of flute and wagon (Japanese harp), and he was Emperor Goshirakawa's music teacher and close adviser.

sen.j: 諸国の受領や、宮内卿、修理職などを歴任。
sen.e: He hold important positions such as Zuryo (the head of the provincial government) in various provinces, Kunaikyo, and Shurishiki (Office of Palace Repairs).
He hold important positions such as Zuryo (the head of the provincial government) in various provinces, Kunaikyo, and Shurishiki (Office of Palace Repairs).
He hold important positions such as Zuryo (the head of the provincial government) in various provinces, Kunaikyo, and Shurishiki (Office of Palace Repairs).

sen.j: 応保元年（1161年）正月従三位に叙せられる。
sen.e: At New Year's of 1161 he was conferred Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
At New Year's of 1161 he was conferred Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
At New Year's of 1161 he was conferred Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).

sen.j: しかし、翌年6月に二条天皇を呪詛した罪で信濃国に流罪になるが、2年後に召還された。
sen.e: However, in July 1162 (表記の変更), he was exiled to Shinano Province for having cursed Emperor Nijo, and two yeas later he was recalled.
However, in July 1162, he was exiled to Shinano Province for having cursed Emperor Nijo, and two yeas later he was recalled.
However, in July 1162, he was exiled to Shinano Province for having cursed Emperor Nijo, and two yeas later he was recalled.

sen.j: その際、後白河院に「田舎住まいで音曲など忘れただろう」という問いに対して、「信濃にあんなる木曽路河」という今様を「信濃に有し木曽路河」と謡い替えた逸話は有名（『十訓抄』『平家物語』などに記載）。
sen.e: There is a famous anecdote related to this occasion as follows: to Goshirakawa-in (the retired Emperor Goshirakawa), who said to him '[a]s you were living a country life, you have forgotten music, haven't you?' he replied reciting a verse of imayo (popular style of song in Heian Period) that originally reads, 'the river along the Kisoji Road which is supposed to be in deep Shinano,' by changing it slightly as, 'the river along the Kisoji Road which surely exists in deep Shinano,' (recorded in "Jikkinsho" [Miscellany of Ten Maxims], "Heike Monogatari" [The Tale of the Heike], etc.).
sen.cmt: 後白河院→Goshirakawa-in (the retired Emperor Goshirakawa)としました。 「田舎住まいで音曲など忘れただろう」→定訳不明：'As you were living a country life, you have forgotten music, haven't you?'としました。 「信濃にあんなる木曽路河」→定訳不明： 'the river along the Kisoji Road which is supposed to be in deep Shinano,' 「あんなる」＝「あるという」と解釈しました。 「信濃に有し木曽路河」→定訳不明：'the river along the Kisoji Road which surely exists in deep Shinano,' 「有し」＝「確かに有る」と解釈しました。
sen.e: There is a famous anecdote related to this occasion as follows: to the Retired Emperor Goshirakawa, who said to him 'As you were living a country life, you have forgotten music, haven't you?' he replied reciting a verse of imayo (popular style of song in Heian period) that originally reads, 'The river along the Kisoji Road which is supposed to be in deep Shinano,' by changing it slightly as, 'The river along the Kisoji Road which surely exists in deep Shinano,' (recorded in "Jikkinsho" [Miscellany of Ten Maxims], "Heike Monogatari" [The Tale of the Heike], etc.).
sen.cmt: Retired Emperor Goshirakawaに訂正しました。As訂正しました。period小文字にしました。The大文字にしました。
sen.e: There is a famous anecdote related to this occasion as follows: to the Retired Emperor Goshirakawa, who said to him 'As you were living a country life, you have forgotten music, haven't you?' he replied reciting a verse of imayo (popular style of song in Heian period) that originally reads, 'The river along the Kisoji Road which is supposed to be in deep Shinano,' by changing it slightly as, 'The river along the Kisoji Road which surely exists in deep Shinano,' (recorded in "Jikkinsho" [Miscellany of Ten Maxims], "Heike Monogatari" [The Tale of the Heike], etc.).

sen.j: 仁安 (日本)元年（1166年）参議に任ぜられる。
sen.e: In 1166, he was appointed.Sangi (councilor).
In 1166, he was appointed Sangi (councilor).
sen.cmt: 不要なピリオドを削除しました。
sen.e: In 1166, he was appointed Sangi (councilor).

sen.j: 承安 (日本)4年（1174年）の今様合において藤原師長とともに判者を務めた。
sen.e: In 1174, when an imayoawase (competition of poem making) was held, he served as a judge with FUJIWARA no Moronaga.
In 1174, when an imayoawase (competition of poem making) was held, he served as a judge with FUJIWARA no Moronaga.
In 1174, when an imayoawase (competition of poem making) was held, he served as a judge with FUJIWARA no Moronaga.

sen.j: 安元元年（1175年）中納言になり按察使を兼任、。
sen.e: In 1175 he became Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), while holding the position of Azechi (inspector of the provincial government).
In 1175 he became Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), while holding the position of Azechi (inspector of the provincial government).
In 1175 he became Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), while holding the position of Azechi (inspector of the provincial government).

sen.j: 治承3年（1179年）権大納言になるが、同年11月の平清盛のクーデター（治承三年の政変）によって解官された。
sen.e: In 1179, he became Gon Dainagon (provisional major councilor of state), however, due to Coup d'etat of TAIRA no Kiyomori (Coup of the Third Year of Jisho), he was dismissed in December 1179 (表記の変更).
In 1179, he became Gon Dainagon (provisional major councilor of state), however, due to Coup d'etat of TAIRA no Kiyomori (Coup of the Third Year of Jisho), he was dismissed in December 1179.
In 1179, he became Gon Dainagon (provisional major councilor of state), however, due to Coup d'etat of TAIRA no Kiyomori (Coup of the Third Year of Jisho), he was dismissed in December 1179.

sen.j: その後、復任して正二位権大納言に至った。
sen.e: Afterwards, he recovered the position and raised to Shonii (Senior Second Rank) Gon Dainagon.
Afterwards, he recovered the position and raised to Shonii (Senior Second Rank) Gon Dainagon.
Afterwards, he recovered the position and raised to Shonii (Senior Second Rank) Gon Dainagon.

sen.j: 寿永元年（1182年）3月20日に出家し、法名を円空とした。
sen.e: On May 1, 1182, he entered the priesthood, and took the homyo (a name given to a person who enters the Buddhist priesthood) Enku.
On May 1, 1182, he entered the priesthood, and took the homyo (a name given to a person who enters the Buddhist priesthood) Enku.
On May 1, 1182, he entered the priesthood, and took the homyo (a name given to a person who enters the Buddhist priesthood) Enku.
In 1188, he died at the age of 76.
